snippet: A hefty portion of the Hudson Yards project on Manhattan’s Far West Side is going to be built within the 100-year-flood plain, just as the World Trade Center development is.
abstract: Jim Dwyer About New York column notes that a hefty portion of the Hudson Yards project on Manhattan’s Far West Side is going to be built within the 100-year-flood plain, just as the World Trade Center development is; says, at least for now, Hurricane Sandy does not seem to have slowed a habit of more than two centuries--building right up to the shorelines of the three islands and mainland that make up New York City.
lead_paragraph: A hefty portion of the Hudson Yards project on Manhattan’s Far West Side is going to be built within the 100-year-flood plain, just as the World Trade Center development is.

headline.seo: Despite Flooding Risk, Development at City’s Edges Continues
headline.main: Still Building at the Edges of the City, Even as Tides Rise
headline.print_headline: Still Building At the Edges Of the City As Tides Rise
